ruleset.name: Code Size Rules (JavaTddPlugin version)
ruleset.description: The Code Size Ruleset contains a collection of rules that find code size related problems. This version of the ruleset includes alternate messages from the main PMD rulesets/codesize.xml ruleset.

rule.message: This method seems to be excessively long. Very long methods indicate a lack of cohesion. Perhaps you could factor out some of the code into helper methods.

This method seems to have an excessive number of formal parameters. Could a collection of these parameters become a new object? If so perhaps a new class should be created to encapsulate some of these parameters. Then pass an object of that type to this method instead.

This class seems to be excessively long. Very long classes indicate a lack of cohesion. Perhaps this class is trying to represent more than one object. Could it be broken into several more cohesive classes? Or could composition be used to simplify the code in this class?

This class seems to have an excessive number of fields. A very large number of fields indicates a lack of cohesion. Perhaps this class is trying to represent more than one object. Could it be broken into several more cohesive classes? Alternatively, might it be better to replace a collection of fields with an ArrayList or another collection class?
